task.title: How to commit your changes to GitHub
task.shortdesc: After you edit your topic files and save the changes to the local repository folder (folder on your computer), you need to "commit" them to your repository on GitHub because it doesn't do this automatically.

context.p: Get in the habit of committing often because this can act as a method to backing up your work in the event your computer crashes.

step.cmd: After you have saved all your files from Oxygen into the folder on your computer, open the GitHub desktop app.
Find your repository in the left sidebar.
Select "changes" to view all the changes you have made to the repository.
Add a comment that summarizes the changes. Something like "added a topic" or "updated content" will do.
Click "Sync" in the upper right corner of the desktop app to synchronize the files from the computer to the GitHub website.
